text: Killer brew, awesome aroma of Spanish cedar and pepper hops. No bell pepper nice white pepper. Flavor has subtle wood notes with hops and light toasty malts. Finishes real clean.

Bottle split at Chris & Ruths pre GBBF Shindig, 07/08/16. 
Black with a solid tan cap.
Nose is rich malts, light peppery spice, molasses, earthy red berry, hint of liquorice.
Taste comprises dark fruit rinds, toffee, molasses, spice, liquorice, faint cherry bite, dark malts, meaty.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent well constructed strong but does get a touch hot!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the pre GBBF chrisos tasting day 2 07/08/2016. Many thanks to Colin for this one. A opaque pitch black coloured pour with a a loose dark tan head. Aroma is spicy Peppercorn, cedar, liquorice. Really spicy pepper on the nose. Flavour is composed of sweet brown sugars, maple, spicy cedar wood, spicy, sugars. Sticky. Palate is medium sweet. Sticky sweet, creamy, lowish carbonation. Interesting but I couldnt drink a lot.

Bottle share at Chrisos Sunday Shindig. Thanks! As Cigar City Humidor Series Double American Black Ale. Opaque black with a foamy tan head, leaving dotted lacing. Aroma is liquorice, molasses, some oil. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is chewy dense sugary malt, liquorice, boiled sweets, twiggy. One for the sugar lovers, but not off-putting. A big beer. (3.8)

Bottle shared at Chris and Ruths pre GBBF shindig; dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, aroma has sweet chocolate, taste has, sweet chocolate, roast malts, some bourbon, sweet chocolate, dark fruits, some tar and sweet molasses.
Bottle at Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF Shindig, 2016 (Sunday sesh.). Black pour with a beige head. Raisin, caramel, licorice and cola aroma. Flavours of cocoa, dark chocolate and raisin. Very nice.

Pre-gbbf-shinding. Fast schwarze Farbe, mittelgroße bräunliche schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig malzig, dunkles malz, leicht holzig, minimal rauchig, Lakritze. Geschmack süß malzig, Lakritze, Gewürze, leicht alkoholisch, lecker.

Bottle from 2013. Pours dark opaque black, small beige head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is blackstrap molasses, licorice, woodiness, cocoa. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, rich and full of flavor; molasses, wood, cocoa, licorice dominate here as well. Would not guess cedar per se. Medium plus body, soft mouthfeel. Solid.

Sampled from a 750 ml bottle from notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small khaki colored head. The aroma and flavor have dark roasted malt, dark chocolate, earthy bitterness, cedar wood, some resiny character, still a bit hot, caramel, some spicy character, I would like another shot at this.

75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, thx alot to Dirk for sharing!, very complex brew, roasted/spicy/woody and slightly smoked/fruity/bitter, yet not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

"As the name suggests, this is an imperial version of a black ipa, aged on cedar. fairly fresh, the cedar comes through more than subtly, but the beer is well balanced between dark malts and molasses, citrus and pine, and cedar. Quite tasty and very aromatic. A little on the rich side, though not hot. Very good."

Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a dark brown with medium creamy beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, smoke, and dark chocolate. Medium mouthfeel with sweet roast, smoke, chocolate, tobacco and light boozy finish. Very impressive.
Lovely, rich black ale with strong chocolate nose. Distinct smokey cedar flavor from the spiral aging. A big body and a thick, creamy brown head.

Bottle @ Gregs dump. Thanks to markwise for sending. Pours a deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Aroma has the characteristic very strong and spicy cedar aroma. Some chocolate and a touch of smoke. Nice body. Rich dark chocolate and a touch of caramel before the spicy cedar onslaught. Finishes with a fuck load of cedar. Pretty good but a little one dimensional.
A great extra from a trade. Dark brown, thick and heavy, luscious and silky, rich chocolate, wood and pine. Delicious.

Black pour with a tan head. Fairly hoppy aroma with plenty of cedar. Hops come through in the flavor as well, with a nice roasty malt backbone to go with it. Cedar comes through in the finish as well. Abv is well-hidden too. A nice offering.

Sampled at esbls. Black beer that looks cool. a spicy nose with earth and chocolate. Wow. This grabs the taste buds. Cedar is huge. So much brightness. Dark fruit and softer wood. Grape jelly. Truthfully there is so much going on. I would not want a lot of this but it is a lotof fun to sample.

Bottled 04JAN13
ABV listed as 11.0%

Pours black with little foam, maybe a rim of light tan foam. Smells like leather, maduro tobacco and dank hops, some roasted malts, and a touch of vinyl. Taste is tobacco like a mutha. It really does remind me of a humidor - Im uncertain of my feelings, yet, I keep drinking it quickly. I must like it....Full bodied with moderate carb and a wet finish. Im really blown away by this beer, and I am torn as to if its in the good way. WTF. Fuck it, I like it.
750ml bottle pours a dark black with a tan head. Roasted malt and hop aroma. Chocolate coffee and hop taste.

Dark almost opaque black color, steady small brownish head. Light cigar aroma, roasted, kind of sweetish toasted aroma, some hoppy notes. Medium to full-bodied. Hoppy, sweetish roasted coffee, long lingering roastyness."Double Black IPA"

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 03.05.2013, 0,75l bottle sampled @ CBC:
Frisk lukt med preg av mørk malt, masse humle, kaffi, brent karamell, gummi, barnåler, kakao, lakris. Frisk lett sødmerik smak med preg av mørk malt, humle, mørke bær, mørkt sukker, kakao, gummi, karamell, kaffi, askebeger gras. Middels bitterhet som set godt. God.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted and dark malts, some dough, a little bit of floral hops, some light chocolate/coffee, and hints of alcohol. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average to smooth texture. Pretty good but could be better.
This one poured a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma was molasses, chocolate, booze and cedar. Flavor was chocolate, roast, herbs, booze and cedar. Abrasive but interesting and tasty.
CBC 2013. Pours black brown with red tones. Aroma is roasted a bit smoke hoppy sweet fruity. Flavor is a s aromadark fruits a bit acidy; elegant.

Bottle at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013 - Session 2. Pours clear, dark brown with a faint, tan cream head. Big cedar wood aroma, some dark malts. Medium to big sweet flavor with loads of cedar, some burnt malts, dark sugars. Full bodied with fine carbonation and oily texture. Tons more cedar still in the finish, dark malts, dark sugar. Pretty one-dimensional, and the cedar character dominates.

Bottle 750ml. @ CBC 2013 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, DenmarkClear dark black brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, wood, ceddar, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, ceddar, roasted, chocolate, grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130503]

Bottle. Pours a black color with a tan head. Has a slightly roasted malty grassy hoppy chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty spicy hoppy caramel and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter piney chocolate finish.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours hazy brownish black with a frothy beige head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is malty and tiny herbal with cedar, roasted malts, dark roast coffee, grapefruit rinds, grass, liquorice, pine needles and tropical fruits. Taste is slightly sweet and bitter with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, cedar, tropical fruit, grapefruit rinds, lemon peal, pine needles, resin and hints of burnt caramel. Mouthfeel is astringent, tiny oily bitter and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with roasted malts, coffee, citrus, burnt cookies and pine.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Hazy orange colour with a small tan head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, licorice, fruit, hops, spice, and woody notes.

Bottle sample @ CBC 2013. The pours black with no head. The nose is roasted malts, licorice, spruce, toffee. The taste is strong cedar wood. Roasted grain. Agressive sprucy hop finish. Dark malt. Medium body, smooth. Overall, this was a pretty divisive beer at the festival. I liked it. The cedar brings a playful character to the beer.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, big thanks to Paul! Thick black pour with creamy tan head, lasts well.  Aroma brings nice oak, cedar, and cigar notes, going into some dark cocoa, caramel, molasses notes, nice balancing pine, slight grass, orange notes as well.  Taste is a mix of lemon, caramel, toffee, slight earth, cocoa, nice coffee notes as well.  Slight orange, grapefruit, and grass as well.  Nicely done, by far one of the more balanced of the humidor series.

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small tan head. Aroma is fruity, peachy and grapefruity, dry roasted malt. Thick malty, wooden and orange fruity. Mellow roasted malty and breadish, light sweet. Bitter and fruity finish.
Bottle @CBC13. Aroma of roasted malt, licorice, faint cedar, spicy-, fruity-, grapefruit- and pine hops. Flavor is malts, spice, cedar, licorice, bitter fuity hops, grapefruit, pine, little booze.

Bottled @ CBC 2013: Black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, cedar, liqourice, pine, grape. Flavour: light fruits, light roast, liqourice, grape, spice, pine, some alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Ends light bitter and roasted  with a light alcoholbite on lips and palate.
Bottle at CBC 2013. Black - offwhite head. Nice hoppy, bruned malts, cedar, white peppery, spicy, light herbal, ok bitterness, some caramel, dry burned malty. Lovely.

Bottle sampled at CBC 2013.  Pours black with a beige head.  Aroma of grass, grapefruit, roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Sample at CBC 2013, Saturday.

Brown with a small tan head. Roasted aroma and taste, hops, soy, licorice, chocolate and some grass. Quite nice.

Bottle at CBC 2013.
Black coloured with a small off-white head.
Light roasted aroma of caramel, cedar and hops.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel with notes of cedar.
Roasted finish.

Bottle @ CBC. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, hop, cedar and wood. Flavour is roasted malts, cedar, hop, citrus, grapefruit, little chocolate, little sweet and quite bitter.
Sample @ CBC. Huge head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are flowers, roast malt, chocolate, coffee and notes of caramel.

Bottle  @ CBC. Pours black with a offwhite head. Aroma of roasted malt, licorice, cedar, spice, fruity hops, grapfruit and pine. Flavor is malts, spice, cedar, licorice, bitter fuity hops, grapefruit, light piney, little booze. Medum body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. Great, but just a tad to spicy for me. 030513
Sampled at CBC 2013. Black with beige head. Strong cedar notes, piney and citric hops, some roasted notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.

Sample from 75 cl. bottle, CBC 2013. Pitch black with a creamy, tan head. Sweet aroma with chocolate, roasted malts, citrus and fruity hops, licorice, dark fruits and an earthy note. Taste is sweet. Full body, thick texture. Finishes sweet and roasted with citrus hops, fruits and chocolate. Supercharged Black IPA.
CBC. Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - pine and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 030513
Brown and sticky! Huge amount of cocoa with some soy(?) and spices. This is one interesting palate! There is a bitter finish but also very licoracy and sweet. Wildly interesting beer

Bottle at CBC 2013. Dark brown beer with a small beige head. Hoppy roasted aroma, chocolate, caramel, grassy, fruity, floral, some licorice. Hoppy toasted cocoa powder flavor, raisins, dades, grassy, floral, hay, some chocolate.

Bottled. A black beer with a thin brown head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus fruits, roasted malt, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, roasted malt, soy sauce, and citrusy hops.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Sampled from bottle @ CBC 2013 kindly shared by Lynh. Almost pitch black, some redness coming through, small light brown head. Smell and taste malts, hops, roastyness, bitter and some alcohol. Full body, medium to full carbonation. -- Rerate August 7th 2016: Sampled @ ChrisO Pre-GBBF Shindig. Opaque black color, medium sized beige head. Aroma is malts, molasses, liquor lightly, raissins, dark fruits. Taste malts, dakr malt, molasses, raisins, some alcohol, liquor, dark malt bitter, bitter. Full body, medium carbonation. Very nice! 8-4-8-4-18=4.2.

75 cl bottle @ CBC13.
Pours dark red-brown color color with a small head. Aroma of hops, brown sugar, roasted malts and citrus. Flavour of citrus fruits, hops, roasted malts and licorice. Nice and creamy smooth.
5318

750 ml bottle @ CBC2013. Pours a dark brown colour with a creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, strong licorice root and caramel. Flavour of roasted malts, licorice root, dark chocolate and grass. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel and a roasty, bready, salty finish. Great stuff.

750ml bottle @ CBC 2013

Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of strong licorice, fruity hops, roasty malts and herbal notes. Taste is quite untypical for a black ipa with loads of licorice, creamy notes, herbal and fruits. Finish is hoppy and creamy with some roastiness and licorice. Okay, quite strong black IPA.

750 ml bottle.  Pours turbid dark blackish with 2-finger creamy light brown head.  Nose is roasty dark malts, spicy black pepperynotes, some fine tobacco and blackberry hints.  Tastes rich, dark malty, hoppy, with that big tangeriney cedar plank humidor flavor that I find incredible.  This one kicks ass.
750ml bottle. Poured a black color with a tan head. Citrus, caramel, some cedar, earthy, and piney. Light alcohol in the finish, but overall well hidden.

Draft... Pitch black ale with a small, creamy, tanned head. The aroma is of chocolate chip brownies, blackstrap molasses, peppery/spicy cedar and a trace of bong water. Ultra full-bodied and chewy with lazy carbonation. The Flavor is burnt and bitter loads of piney, resiny hops, charcoal, blackstrap and black malt. Finishes bittersweet and scorched with an afterthought of chocolate. This is a big-time, bad m*thrf*ckr of a carbonic IBA.

Pours a deep pitch dark black with a nice mocha head.  Nose is hoppy with a sweet fruit fragrance. Taste is chocolate and malt with raisins and currants. Full of complex flavors with the cedar well appreciated. Carbonation is mild to moderate with a heavy texture. Finishes on chocolate fruity cedar notes. An amazing ale. Another winner from CCB. Quaff Score 9 / 10

Pours black with a dissipating brown head and nice sweet aroma of hops and citrus. Taste is delicious and complex, of cedar, chocolate, roasted malt, hops, and pine notes with a bitter, powerful, long finish. Great brew by CCB, great tasting, unique strong ale

Bomber from Crown Wine and Spirits in Port St. Lucie shared with Eric and my other brother. Pours a very black with a foamy tannish head Aroma has shoe polish, citrus (oranges, mangos), spicy cigars, sweet caramel and chewy resin.  Taste is of sweet caramel, spices, citrusy fruit - mainly lemons/oranges - plus resin and that cedar presence ... Finishes dry and spicy, with some bittersweetness. Alcoholly and strong. Not that big a fan of humidor.

750 ml bottle from trade with OmegaX.  Pours pitch black with a 2 finger, brown, creamy head that fades slowly, leaves nice lacing too.  Great appearance.  Aroma is a bit faint but really nice.  Roasted malt, dark chocolate, cedar, and molasses.  Wow, what a great tasting beer though.  Did not expect it to be this good based on the faint aroma.  Packed with dark bitter chocolate, cedar wood, roasted malts, hints of soy sauce and tobacco.  Creamy finish with lots of sticky tobacco, cedar, and a touch of spiciness.  The mouthfeel is somehow silky smooth, creamy, oily, and sticky, all at some point as the temperature changes.  Ive pretty much slammed this beer while writing the review and the cedar definitely becomes more pronounced in the aroma and taste as it warms.  Great beer.  Surprised to see the ratings relatively low on this.  The only thing keeping this from being a top beer of mine is the somewhat faint aroma.

Bottle thanks to a trade. Pours a very dark brown with a deep brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has a good amount of cedar with creamy dark grains and a hint of roasted malts. Flavor has a touch of sweet dark grains up front with roasted malts and light cedar in the finish.

Bottle shared by Derek, thanks! Looks very dark mahogany with a brown head that lasts on the edge and thin film across the top. nose is loads of roasted malt and cedar  translating into a woodsy chocolate. Taste is chocolaty sweetness cut with the bitter malt. not as much cedar as in the nose, would have liked more but very solid overall.

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured clear dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy earthy & toasted dark malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations were exceeded.

Sample from a 750ml bottle. Dark brown color. Thin bubbly light brown head. Very nice earthy roasty piney nose. Good chocolate, cinnamon, light molasses. Bitter taste, light spicy bite. Bigger body, lighter carbonation. Very nice hoppy black ale.
750 ml bottle to snifter. Looks good; black with thin light beige lacing. Smells of HEAVY dark malt and hops. Tastes like it smells with a good, but hot mouthfeeel. Good, but WHOO!!!
an interesting take on a black ale, lots of dry spice, a bit of pepper, some dark fruits. dry finish on the tongue. kinda neat, not super interesting.

Bottle.  Pours opaque black with a thin beige head.  Aroma of black currants, licorice, coriander, and floral notes.  Taste is like nothing else Ive ever had: licorice, lots of coriander, other spices, burnt notes, black currants, with a rough woody finish.  Balanced - not sweet or bitter.  Full body.  Very interesting and enjoyable beer.

Tap flight at House if Beer.  Mahogany brown pours its a densely coating brown head.  The glass literally looks painted around the rim.  Slight vinous and sour nose.  Taste is complex and hard to describe. Its woody, roasty, chocolaty, and peppery from the cedar.  The hops are well integrated into the beer giving it an aromatic and floral quality.  I am amazed by how creamy CCB can make some beers feel in your mouth.  This is velvety...no, silky...no, lambs skin smooth.  I am so surprised by this.  Fantastic.

750 mL bottle courtesy of Chris, served in a snifter. Pours black with a moderate tan head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are huge notes of resin, pine, citrus and wood along with roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. The flavour is fairly dry and moderately bitter with resin, pine and roasty notes. It closes out with a long, hoppy resinous bitter finish. On the palate it is full in body with a dryish texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is an amazing black ale with a beautiful hop profile. 2013-03-02
Bottle at Franks. Black pour with white head. Aroma is thick tannic spices. Taste has signature cedar flavor with brown sugar notes and molasses. Not overly sweet.nicely balanced.

Bottle at franks. Pours a deep brown body with light of white bubbles. Aroma is sweet chocolate and light hop. Mouthfeel is sweet, with notes of cedar, chocolate, sharp bitter hop and light booze. Very strange combination of flavors - not a huge fan, but interesting.

Pours oily with small head. Aroma of hops with strong lemon citrus aroma. Surprisingly light on the palate. Taste is strong orange with some bitterness. Malty orange juice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle from MeadMe. Thanks, Greg! Oscars Night - CCB Rate #98. Pours a richer deep blackish hue, touches of midnight ruby, lighter copper brown edge shows just a touch of light. Dark and opaque body has some firmer thickness, loose brownish head dies to a frothy small filmy layer, laces ok. Aromas are a melange of aromas, showing cocoa and toffee, piney and floral hops, kiss of citrus, bigger resiny dryness, firmer cedar wood, gentle spice and firm stronger dryness hits the nose. Cocoa, some gentle coffee, and toasty malts. Some grapefruit, lemon, more florals and pine meet those dark roasty, sticky malts. Initial is fuller bodied, a bit thicker on the palate with toast, pine and florals. Grapefruit, sticky caramel, cocoa, and biscuits. A nice dryness, mellow coffee, and cedar wood spice dries this up a bit. Coffee and cocoa elements into the middle, dry and roasty elements come on. Grapefruit, florals, pine dry out more into the backend past some of that sticky malt thicker middle. Toasty and roasty, dry hop presence, biscuits and cocoa, black malts. This comes together well, though it certainly is bigger in body. Toasty, roasty, dry finish is pleasant. Florals and pine are medium, touches of grapefruit, dry cedar elements. Its not a big hop presence, a touch deadened, but the dryness, cedar, and hop profile give a firm oomph of dryness, bitterness into that backend and really throughout. A bit stronger as it warms. Really comes together for me despite being a bit big. An Imperial Black IPA seemingly. Solid beer here.

Pours dark brown color with tan head. Citrus and moderately roasted malt aromas with hints of cedar. Spicy cedar flavor with roasted malts and some citrus hops. Medium body with average carbonation. Good stuff.

Pours black with a creamy light brown head. Huge nose on this. Pine, grassiness, and grapefruit galore with a dry roasted hint. Creamy thick mouthfeel. Sharp pine bite up front leads to a roasted grain finish and a lingering cocoa on thr palate. Dry finish that I am guessing is the cedar. Bit of sweetness well balanced by the bitter. One of the more complex flavor progiles I have had. This is really really good. Curious is age would mellow the hops and turn this into a chocolatey imperial porter.

1 pint+9.4oz bottle. Beautiful pour that looks like a thick stout with sticky lacing.  This beer is thick and delicious. I have never had an American black ale this good. Aroma is interesting,  don?t know if I?d call it smokey, maybe roasted malts. Sweet start bitter finish.  Almost stouty. Great beer.

Pours thick and dark like a stout. Nose is sweet tobacco with a little citrus. Taste is very spicy -- wood, cigar, smoke, followed by sour citrus, then a lingering dry, spicy aftertaste. Admire the craft, didnt love the taste.

Snifter pour at CCB, poured a dark black color with aromas of cedar, roast, light earth, and a touch of anise.  Flavors are roasted malt with a ton of cedar.  Light bitterness in the aftertaste and the cedar was more dominate as the beer warms.

Pours a thick black with a dark ominous  head. Lots if cedar in the nose, big hops and some roasted notes. Nice medium body thickness, chocolate, roasted grains, citrus hops in the taste. Nice lingering bitterness in the finish. Really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark black pour out of the bottle. Tan head with big bubbles that lace and stick. Smells hoppy with some dark malts and a bit of the woody character.  Taste caught me guard. Sweet, smoky from the cedar, and some bitterness from the hop/roasted malts. Comes together nice. Pretty silky. Vanilla notes in there too. Faint coffee.

Pours a rich black umber color with a nice tan sticky foam... Aromas are sweet citrus and pine hop notes mingling with roasted chocolate malts and earthy woodsy spice. The palate is phenomena. Great sweet cedar spice powers through the deep dark fruit, juicy hops and chocolate creaminess to make a complex layer of flavors that meld together nicely !

750ml bottle from Proof.  Black-brown pour with medium tan head and a little lacing.  Aroma is cedar, orange, burnt malt, cocoa.  Creamy palate is the first thing I noticed - strange syrupy and rich.  Tastes are molasses, light smoke, coffee, sweet chocolate, vanilla, wood, citrus, soy.  Catch more of the black ipa in the finish - charred vibe.  Strange brew.

750 ml bottle via trade with smith4498 - Pours a dark brown color with a one finger thick tan head.  Very light spotty lacing.  Aroma is pine and resin hops and a bit of roasted malt.  Flavor is pine hops, chocolate, dark esters, and cedar.  Full body.  I love these Humidor Series beers.  The cedar spiciness makes the beer.  Thanks Jason.

Smooth black ale. Very smooth. Super smooth. Incredibly smooth. Pours black. On the tongue, roasted malts, with slight hoppy bitterness, and a complex, unending sweetness that I can't pinpoint. To say it hides its ABV is an understatement -- if I had to guess, I'd wager 5-6% and not 11%. Good good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at CCB.  Pours the usual CCB obsidian color with a dark tan head.  Nose is big roast, some spicy cedar, some dark chocolate, some ash, some earth, and some black burnt coffee. Flavor is similar with roasted malts, big earthy black coffee, some ash, some dark chocolate, and spicy cedar.  Medium to full in body and beastly in every way.

draft at winter warmer asheville nc. poured black with dark brown head. big hops and chocolate bitter aroma and flavor. dark malts, sweet. very rich flavor some alcohol burn on back end. loved it...first beer of the day.

On tap at the Winter Warmer 2012, this pours almost opaque black into the glass, with a frothy tan head that leaves suds lacing. The nose is gorgeous; earth, sours, tobacco, hay, silage and grains. Flavors are spot on as well; malt, grains, sour barnyard... Nice! Full bodied and alive on the palate with complexities. Great job on this!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Thanks matt. Pours black with massive tan head. Big hop and caramel aroma. Taste is thick sweet hops.

On tap at BX Beer Depots CCB Tap Takeover

Big time cedar in the nose and flavor - very aggressive. Chocolate, cocoa and tons of hops make this a very robust beer. Chocolatey cedar finish.

On tap. Black pour with a medium tan head and a lot of lacing. Cedar, bitter chocolate, hoppy spice. Flavor is kind of all over the place - the cedar barrel element dominates, followed by some molasses sweetness, then a big hops finish. Doesnt really come together.

Draft.  Small tan head atop black body with brown edge.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some roast, light wood.  Taste is moderately sweet, roast, some wood, grapefruit, light alcohol warming.  Full body, some stickiness, resin.

1/18/13. 750mL bottle from Grassroots Natural Market. Rich black pour with a nice tan head. Looking through ratings, its obvious who was told smoke and who drank blind/unknowing. Rich, sweet aroma with lots of hops, almost black IPA territory, with wood, cherries, and what could be perceived as sweet barbecue. Maybe. Rich, sweet flavor as well with a ton of hop - citrus, dank, and more - on top of cherry, ash, and lingering sweet, dark fruits. Its like a black IPA on misspelled steroids. Maybe youve heard of me? Im top on BA.
Enjoyed at the CC Tasting room. Big smoke aroma, medium mouthfeel.  Tons of flavour. Lacey black.  A black IPA on steroids.  Possibly best beer of my FL trip.

Pours jet black with a dark mocha head. Aroma of cedar and that's all, it's pretty forward in this one. Taste is cedar and roast, slight sweetness. It's like a thin humidor Zhukov. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle .. . deep black brown .. good head, medium strength lacing .. . cedar, tar, cooking chocolate, balsa, and light burnt bbq wood .. . medium mouth, quick finish .. . wonderfully flavourful beer but doesnt quite hold to the end.. . . pigs dont have eyelashes

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2013 Bottle from the brewery, pours pitch black with medium sized mocha head, lots of different sized bubbles. Body is very full with a syrupy mouth feel. Good amount of lace. Aroma is unbelievable, so much grapefruit rind and blood orange when swirled, smaller notes of cocoa powder, burnt malt, perfume, blackberry and cedar.  Taste was on the rich side compared to the fruity hop aroma...notes were smoked wood, cigars, molasses, bitter coffee and chocolate.  Finish is warming in the chest which should be expected at 11%. Nice American Strong from Cigar city.

Pours a translucent brownish-black from the bottle with thin tan head and light lacing. Aroma of dark roasted malts and heavy hops. Taste is like a black ipa with lots of hops, a bit of coffee, and some piney resins. Great beer.

Thanks Scott! Pitch black pour dark khaki head. Ceder wood spice pine roasted malts. pine and ceder followed by roasted malts. Finished with a roasted medicinal astringency that I picked but others disagreed. Theres something about roasted beers with thin body that I dont like. This beer is better than my rating but I just cant get over the medicinal astringency.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2013 Thanks to Scott! Almost black pour with a creamy tan head that fades to a ring. Gigantic piney hops, cedar and roasted malts with hints of coffee. Slightly creamy entry with roasted malts, cocoa and then more piney, hints of spicy hops. Maybe cedar is making it taste like that? Medium full bodied with light notes of astringency. Stevencon wants to battle on an acetone taste but hes wrong.
Bottle poured into glass. Super dark pour with good carbonation. Hoppy all around with a slight burnt char flavor to it. Nice solid malt backing. Sure doesnt drink like an 11% beer thats for sure.

Snifter pour of dark thin liquid, khaki head. Nose is dark, rich malt, roasty, light hoppiness, chocolate malt. Flavor is dark chocolate with heavy hops. Roasty malts and healthy cedar. Very nice, but noticeable at 11%.. Im good with one.

Wow... I thought it would be good but not THIS good. It poured like Zhukov, plus smelled like tootsie rolls and coffee. The body was smooth and almost chewy with flavors of rich chocolate, vanilla, oak and a surprising hop back-end. Simply fantastic.

I thoroughly enjoyed this brew. The aroma was intensely chocolatey and roasty with a nice citrus hop bite and some cedar aromas. The pour was super black with a tan head. Flavors are similar with a nice mix of roasted and chocolate malts, some fresh hops, mainly grapefruit and orange, and some fresh wood. Very smooth on the palate. Awesome stuff.
